body_html: I see. We should probably harden our in-place ops to better check at least for the common case of an expanded tensor and tell people that they will get incorrect results. Many programs that previously were perfectly safe will not give bad results, because people (or really our in-place ops that people use) assumed things will be non-overlapping in memory.
body_text: I see. We should probably harden our in-place ops to better check at least for the common case of an expanded tensor and tell people that they will get incorrect results. Many programs that previously were perfectly safe will not give bad results, because people (or really our in-place ops that people use) assumed things will be non-overlapping in memory.
body: I see. We should probably harden our in-place ops to better check at least for the common case of an expanded tensor and tell people that they will get incorrect results. Many programs that previously were perfectly safe will not give bad results, because people (or really our in-place ops that people use) assumed things will be non-overlapping in memory.
